data.persona: I am so sick of this peasantry demanding more food! It's not my fault they didn't grow enough to pay their grain taxes and eat! Lazy peasants are always wanting something. Sometimes, I think I should take my guards, and my money and leave. Let them deal with the wolves and the bandits on their own.
data.description:
You are in the Training Fields.
The training fields are a large expanse of grass fields, filled with all sorts of training apparatus for the noblemen and soldiers. The grass is not anything fancy, scuffed up and dry in many places, but it gets the job done. There are hay bails arranged all over, training courses, archery targets, weights and more scattered about in stations.
There's a Targets, a training apparatus, a bow, a spears, an arrow, a weights, a target, a bail, a fence, and a bows here.
The horse and the trainer are here.

You are carrying a purse, wearing a Ring, a signet ring, and a vest, and wielding a sword, a knife, and a ritual knife.

data.short_motivation: I want to take my horse out of the training fields.
data.mid_motivation: I want to travel to a nearby town to take a break from my peasants.
data.long_motivation: I want to show the peasants what happens when I leave so that they will be grateful for me instead of constantly asking me for more food.

timeline.label: 1 hour ago
